item.title: I, We, or no one: Does gender matter?
item.description: Originally published on February 9, 2016 at grayiscolorful.blogspot.com How do writers refer to their own single author work when writing about it? Do they use singular pronouns (e.g. ‘I predict the existence of a 9th planet’), more participative plural pronouns (e.g. ‘Our model fits the observed data’), or avoid pronouns all together (e.g. ‘The paper examines tool usage by parrots’)? Is there a difference between male and female authors?
